snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg does go to storm-ravaged communities, but he does not stay long with residents, a sign that the halting recovery has laid bare his discomfort with the role of soothing his city.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg visits communities ravaged by Hurricane Sandy, but does not stay long, signalling his discomfort with role of soothing his city; appears to be more at ease in formal news briefings than with offering one-on-one emotional support.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg does go to storm-ravaged communities, but he does not stay long with residents, a sign that the halting recovery has laid bare his discomfort with the role of soothing his city.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Puts Soothing Aside as He Rushes to Bring Back City
